buyer_ref.description: Buyer's reference for the media buy

start.description: ISO 8601 start timestamp for measurement period

end.description: ISO 8601 end timestamp for measurement period

performance_index.description: Normalized performance score (0.0 = no value, 1.0 = expected, >1.0 = above expected). Deprecated: use metric_value with metric_type instead for precise measurement data.

package_id.description: Specific package within the media buy (if feedback is package-specific)

creative_id.description: Specific creative asset (if feedback is creative-specific)

metric_value.description: The measured value for the metric_type. For example, 3.2 for a 3.2x ROAS, or 0.72 for 72% viewability. Use alongside metric_type and metric_unit for precise measurement data.

metric_unit.description: Unit for metric_value (e.g., 'ratio', 'percent', 'count', 'usd'). Enables correct interpretation of the value.

measurement_provider.description: Name of the third-party measurement provider (e.g., 'Nielsen', 'Kantar', 'DoubleVerify', 'IAS'). Identifies the source of truth for the measurement.

measurement_methodology.description: Measurement methodology or standard used (e.g., 'MRC viewability', 'MTA last-touch', 'MMM', 'geo-incrementality'). Enables sellers to contextualize and act on feedback accurately.

feedback_type.description: Type of feedback being provided. optimization_signal: routine performance data for seller optimization. correction: buyer believes seller reporting is inaccurate and provides authoritative measurement. dispute: formal challenge to reported metrics for billing reconciliation.
